testsuite.name: SiteGenesis-Community-TestSuite
testsuite.description:
This is a functional test suite for Salesforce Commerce Cloud (formerly known as Demandware) SiteGenesis, the best practice ecommerce reference store implementation for and by Salesforce.
Because test suites sometimes tend to become complex and hard to maintain, we realized it is time to build a clearly structured test suite with a well-defined set of tests.
The project idea is to collect experiences, consolidate knowledge and share ideas of testing practices. Although this test suite is based on testing the storefront of the demo shop __Salesforce__ __Commerce Cloud__ __SiteGenesis__ the underlying concepts and the communicated know-how are valid for building test suites of other web applications as well. Everybody is invited to use it, learn from it, improve it and adapt it to their needs.
Possible use cases are:
- Test suite to automate new store based on Salesforce Commerce Cloud SiteGenesis - Starting point for test development with fast learning curve - Demonstration of test automation and test suite structuring - Reusable best practices in other (existing) projects
This test suite has been built for and with __XLT__

testcase.description:
Test add and remove product option in cart.
# Setup and preparation
- Start session, open homepage and delete all visible cookies - Add option product with configured quantity and no selected option to cart - Go to cart
# Scope
- Add product option - Validate calculated option price (product quantity * option price) - Validate calculated subtotal (product price total + option price total) - Remove option and validate it
Note: Different options are handled as data driven test configured in a dataset file. Please execute the generated wrapper class as JUnit test for testing all options.
testcase.name: tests.cart.TCart_AddRemoveProductOption

testcase.description:
Test validates the persistant cart feature. It consists of two parts. One for the persistant user cart and one for the site. (Caution: make sure the persistent cart feature is activated in the BM)
# Setup and preparation
- Start session, open homepage and delete all visible cookies. - Create a new Account - Search and add a product to the cart - Store product data
# Scope
## Persistent user cart
- validate product in cart - logout - delete viseblie cookies - login - validate that product is still in cart
## Persistent site cart
- open clean page - Search Product and add to cart (the same as before ) - validate cart - delete cookies - open site again - validate cart
testcase.name: tests.cart.TCart_ValidatePersistentCart

testcase.description:
Test login using an invalid password.
# 1. Setup and preparation
- Start session, open homepage and delete all visible cookies - Create new account with profile data
# 2. Scope of test
- Click login link in the header and go to the login page - Validate login page - Enter username, invalid password and try to login - Validate error message
# 3. Clean up
- End session and clean up created cookies
testcase.name: tests.account.TAccountLogin_InvalidPassword

testcase.description:
Test search wishlist by name and email.
# 1. Setup and preparation
- Start session, open homepage and delete all visible cookies - Create accounts for wishlist owner and searcher - Add two products to owners wishlist - Logout
# 2. Scope of test
- Verify wishlist is not searchable by default - Make wishlist public and one item private - Search wishlist by firstname and lastname - Search wishlist by email
Notes: - Test navigates to the wishlist via account menu, secondary navigation and header user menu. - Test is not splitted into more than one case for now, because setup is expensive.
testcase.name: tests.wishlist.TWishList_SearchWishList

testcase.description:
Verifies the functionality of a buy5for50 promotion.
# Setup - Open the homepage and remove cookies - Put four promotion products into the cart - Validate that no promotion is shown
# Scope Validate correct funtionality of the promotion
- change quantity to five - validate that promotion is shown correctly - change quantity to six - validate that promotion is shown correctly - change quantity to ten - validate that promotion is shown correctly - change quantity back to 4 - validate that no promotion is shown
testcase.name: tests.promotion.TPromotion_Buy5For50

testcase.description:
Test refresh products and calculate sums with update quantity and resort rows in cart. This test needs a full desktop view of the browser, otherwise the minicart won't display the total and the test will fail.
# 1. Setup and preparation
- Start session, open homepage and delete all visible cookies.
# 2. Scope of test
* Add four products to the cart (1, 2, 3, 4) * Remove last item in cart (4) * Remove middle item (2) * Remove first item (1) * Remove the last item (3) * Validate quantity total of minitcart and the item position and content every time * Does not validate the cart totals right now, except when the cart is filled for the first time
testcase.name: tests.cart.TCart_RemoveProducts

testcase.description:
Test guest checkout with one variation product with color and size and VISA. Uses a different address for shipping than billing. Besides that it is identically to TCheckoutOrder_AsGuest.
# 1. Setup and preparation
- Start session, open homepage and delete all visible cookies - Add variation product having color and size to cart (quantity 1)
# 2. Scope of test
- Start guest checkout - Enter new address and use preselected default shipping method - Use different addresss for billing and use payment method credit card (visa) - Validate place order page - Validate order confirmation page - Create an account - Validate customer name and profile - Validate order via order history
Note: This test is prepared as data driven test. Running it as junit test will execute the test multiple times using the set of test data in the _datasets.xml file. The configured example places orders with different cart quantities and combinations of addresses.
testcase.name: tests.checkout.TCheckoutOrder_AsGuest_DifferentBillingAddress

testcase.description:
Verifies variant dropdown selection updates product price and number on quickview and product detail page.
# 1. Setup and preparation
- Start session, open homepage and delete all visible cookies - Search leads to search result page - Open quickview - Validate preconditions
# Scope
## Quickview - Select first variation from dropdown - Verify that price and product number are changed - Deselect variation from dropdown - Verify that price and product number are NOT changed - Select last variation from dropdown - Verify that price and product number are changed
## Product details page - Open pdp from quickview - Verify that dropdown value is preselected with same value - Select variation from dropdown - Verify that price and product number are changed - Deselect variation from dropdown - Verify that price and product number are NOT changed
testcase.name: tests.product.TProduct_Validate_VariationProductDropdownOnlyFunctionality

testcase.description:
(JAVA)-Test sort by price.
# 1. Setup and preparation
- Start session, open homepage and delete all visible cookies - Search for products - Select items per page randomly
# 2. Scope of test
- Sort by price low to high - Validate sorting order - Sort by price high to low - Validate sorting order
Notes: - Validating sorting order is implemented as java module which is not executed in script developer. - There is a data set configured for multiple data driven executions via JUnit.
testcase.name: tests.catalog.TCatalogProductListing_SortByPrice

testcase.description:
Test returning customer order with two saved addresses, saved credit card and two basic products including valdiation of order summary via check order status in account.
# 1. Setup and preparation
- Start session, open homepage and delete all visible cookies - Create new account with profile data - Add one address to account for shipping - Add another address to account for billing - Add credit card to account for billing. - Logout - Add product 01 to cart (quantity 1) - Add product 02 to cart (quantity 2)
# 2. Scope of test
- Start checkout as returning customer - Select saved shipping address and configured shipping method - Select saved billing address and credit card - Validate place order page - Validate order confirmation, store order number and date - Logout - Validate order summary via check order status
testcase.name: tests.checkout.TCheckoutOrder_RegisteredReturningCustomer

testcase.description:
Test refresh products with update quantity and resort rows in mini cart. **Caution:** Browser window needs to be 1200 pixels wide to show totals subtotal in header.
# 1. Setup and preparation
- Start session, open homepage and delete all visible cookies - Add product 01 to cart (quantity 1) - Add product 02 to cart (quantity 2) - Store subtotal
# 2. Scope of test
## Product 01 and 02 - Validate products
- Validate header items - Validate body product 01 in row 2 - Validate body product 02 in row 1 - Validate body subtotal
## Product 01 and 02 - Change quantities
- Change product 01 quantity to 3 - Change product 02 quantity to 4 - Validate updated header items - Validate updated mini cart body product 01 in row 2 - Validate updated mini cart body product 02 in row 1 - Validate updated mini cart body subtotal
## Product 01 and 02 - Remove and rearrange rows
- Remove product 02 - Validate updated mini cart body product 01 in row 1 - Remove product 01 - Validate empty cart - Validate empty mini cart
testcase.name: tests.minicart.TMiniCart_Validate_UpdateQuantities

testcase.description:
Test guest checkout with one variation product with color and size, one address and VISA.
# 1. Setup and preparation
- Start session, open homepage and delete all visible cookies - Add variation product having color and size to cart (quantity 1)
# 2. Scope of test
- Start guest checkout - Enter new address and use preselected default shipping method - Use same as shipping address for billing and use payment method credit card (visa) - Validate place order page - Validate order confirmation page - Create an account - Validate customer name and profile - Validate order via order history
Note: This test is prepared as data driven test. Running it as junit test will execute the test multiple times using the set of test data in the _datasets.xml file. The configured example places orders with different types of credit cards.
testcase.name: tests.checkout.TCheckoutOrder_AsGuest

testcase.description:
Test add, remove, edit, make default address in addressbook of my account.
# 1. Setup and preparation
- Start session, open homepage and delete all visible cookies - Create new account with profile data - Login to account using the global link in the header
# 2. Scope of test
- Go to address book - Validate nav, page and empty list - Add address and cancel dialog - Create two new addresses and validate both - Make second address default and validate resorting - Edit and cancel first address - Edit and submit second address - Remove both addresses and validate resorting - Validate empty list
# 3. Clean up
- Logout using the global link in the header - End session and clean up created cookies

testcase.description:
Test new customer checkout with two variation products with color and size, different quantities, two saved addresses and credit card visa including validation after checkout of profile data in created account and order number in order history.
# 1. Setup and preparation
- Start session, open homepage and delete all visible cookies - Add variation product 01 to cart (color, size, list price, quantity 1) - Add variation product 02 to cart (color, size, list and sales price, quantity 2)
# 2. Scope of test
- Start new customer checkout - Enter and confirm new profile data - Enter new shipping address, add it to address book and select configured shipping method - Enter new billing address, add it to address book and use payment method credit card (visa) - Validate place order page - Validate order confirmation page and store order number - Validate stored profile data in the account area - Validate stored addresses in account address book - Validate order history in account, check order number - Go to account - Validate customer name and profile - Validate shipping and billing address - Validate credit card in payment settings - Validate order via order history - Logout
testcase.name: tests.checkout.TCheckoutOrder_RegisteredNewCustomer

testcase.description:
Functional responsive design test guest checkout with one variation product with color and size, one address and visa.
# 1. Setup and preparation
- Start session, open homepage and delete all visible cookies - Add variation product having color and size to cart (quantity 1)
# 2. Scope of test
- Start guest checkout - Enter new address and use preselected default shipping method - Use same as shipping address for billing and use payment method credit card (visa) - Validate place order page - Validate order confirmation page - Create an account - Validate customer name and profile - Validate order via order history - Logout

testcase.description:
Test refresh products and calculate sums with update quantity and resort rows in cart. This test needs a full desktop view of the browser, otherwise the minicart won't display the total and the test will fail.
# Setup and preparation
- Start session, open homepage and delete all visible cookies.
# Scope
## Product 01 - Change quantity via update cart
- Add product 01 to cart (quantity 1). - Validate product and subtotal. - Increase quantity to random value via update cart function. - Calculate formatted total product price based on updated quantity. - Validate product price and subtotal.
## Product 02 - Change quantity via edit dialog
- Add product 02 to cart (quantity 2). - Calculate formatted total product price. - Calculate subtotal and number of items for both products. - Validate both products and subtotal. - Increase product 02 quantity to random value via edit details dialog. - Calculate new subtotal and number of items for both products. - Validate calculated values in mini cart header. - Validate both products and subtotal on cart page.
testcase.name: tests.cart.TCart_UpdateQuantities

testcase.description:
Test add, edit, and remove credit card data in account payment settings.
# 1. Setup and preparation
- Start session, open homepage and delete all visible cookies - Create new account with profile data - Login to account using the global link in the header
# 2. Scope of test
- Go to payment settings - Validate nav, page and empty list - Add credit card and cancel dialog - Create two new credit cards and validate both - Remove both credit cards and validate resorting - Validate empty list
# 3. Clean up
- Logout using the global link in the header - End session and clean up created cookies
testcase.name: tests.account.TAccountPaymentSettings_CRUDCreditCards
